snippet: Voters in two states approved making marijuana possession legal, but the states may now be on a collision course with the federal government.
abstract: Voters in Colorado and Washington endorse legalization of recreational marijuana use in historic vote that draws comparisons to end of Prohibition; states, however, may clash with federal government, which still views marijuana as Schedule I prohibited substance.
lead_paragraph: Voters in two states approved making marijuana possession legal, but the states may now be on a collision course with the federal government.

headline.seo: Marijuana Laws Eased in Colorado and Washington
headline.main: Voters Ease Marijuana Laws in 2 States, but Legal Questions Remain
headline.print_headline: Voters Ease Marijuana Laws in 2 States, but Legal Questions Remain
